intro: Lastrea maximowiczii, commonly known as the Zulu ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and adapted to arid environments. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming structure with blue-gray foliage that reflects sunlight. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and appear in clusters during the spring. It is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
